intro: Orlaya platycarpos, commonly known as the narrowleaf false flax, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Orlaya platycarpos thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. It is often found in the eastern United States and parts of Canada.
